timeline.message: Implement IShapedRecipe and add new module patchwork-recipes
Implement IShapedRecipe and add new module patchwork-recipes

Revert "Annotation Scanning"

This reverts commit a026906ed98df83dd0ecd3c4bd5e0cfcba88e7fd.
Change to overwrite to make annotation processor happy.

timeline.bodyText: Can we get some markers on where the actual code changes are with comments? I'm assuming it's just here but it's difficult to tell.
timeline.author: TheGlitch76

+package net.patchworkmc.mixin.recipes;
+
+import java.util.Iterator;
+
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Overwrite;
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Shadow;
+import net.minecraftforge.common.crafting.IShapedRecipe;
+
+import net.minecraft.util.math.MathHelper;
+import net.minecraft.recipe.Recipe;
+import net.minecraft.recipe.RecipeGridAligner;
+
+@Mixin(RecipeGridAligner.class)
+public interface MixinRecipeGridAligner {
+	@Shadow
+	void acceptAlignedInput(Iterator<?> inputs, int slot, int amount, int gridX, int gridY);
+
+	/**
+	 * @author qouteall
+	 * @reason https://github.com/FabricMC/Mixin/issues/15
+	 */
+	@Overwrite
+	default void alignRecipeToGrid(
+			int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int gridOutputSlot,
+			Recipe<?> recipe, Iterator<?> inputs, int amount
+	) {
+		int width = gridWidth;
+		int height = gridHeight;
+
+		if (recipe instanceof IShapedRecipe) {

replies.bodyText: Yes, it's generally good practice to annotate the changed parts when using @Overwrite.
replies.author: coderbot16
